channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found 4-13 at 7pm in the load area, carton was wet and was brought to QA for inspection DescribePack: inner containers had loose and missing lids which resulted in internal leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ppe was used to contain package in a plastic hazmat bag which was then placed in a sealed plastic tote

item.title: Report X-2024040900
item.description:
Report X-2024040900

  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package was put on it's side on rollers during loading, causing cap to become loose on 1 bottle of product, causing internal leakage. QA was notified, package was placed upright in plastic lined tote to prevent additional leakage. DescribePack: Package was placed on it's side, causing cap to loosen. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright in plastic tote to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024040819
item.description:
Report X-2024040819

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: BOWLING GREEN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found while unloading a trailer with the outer packaging wet. It was immediately removed from the operation and brought to a ventilated area. Upon opening the package, both caps for the 2 1-gallon bottles were cracked or broken off. The result was a small spillage of the hazardous material, contained in the package. DescribePack: Closures on the bottle were cracked DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Immediate removal from the sort and placement into a lined hazardous material bucket

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading a pallet of bags from trailer forklift operator rubbed one of the bags on the pallet against the trailer wall which consequently ripped the bag contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled product was swept up and placed into a recovery container and ripped bag was repaired and sent to ultimate consignee without further incident.

item.title: Report E-2024040458
item.description:
Report E-2024040458

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO LOGISTICS contacted ERTS regarding one punctured 1-gallon bottle of Master Care Pro-Red Plus™ as a result of improper loading / inadequate preparation for transportation. Approximately 0.5-gallons of product spilled onto the concrete dock floor in a 2’x2’ area. A Contractor neutralized the release using a citric acid solution and containerized the damaged product into one 35-gallon DF for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024040252
item.description:
Report E-2024040252

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the concrete terminal floor and estimated that one (1) ounce of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. First Call Environmental personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted area and recovered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum along with the damaged 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024040070
item.description:
Report I-2024040070

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: Grove City
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: STG LOGISTICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. One 55-gallon drum was punctured by a forklift while staged at the STG Logistics facility. Approximately 2 quarts of free liquid were released from the damaged drum to the warehouse floor. Area was secured and Green Charge was contracted to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival, free product was detected on the warehouse floor, and contained to immediate area. Green Charge utilized absorbent material and recovered all product. The damaged drum was overpacked to prevent further incident. Spent absorbents were placed into one 55-gallon drum, pending disposal in accordance with local, state, and federal regulations. There were no injuries or exposures reported.
